verses.verse: Israel<WH3478> is a empty<WH1238> vine<WH1612>, he brings forth<WH7737> fruit<WH6529> unto himself<WH7230>: according to the multitude of his fruit<WH6529> he has increased<WH7235> the altars<WH4196>; according to the goodness<WH2896> of his land<WH776> they have made good<WH2895> images<WH4676>.
Their heart<WH3820> is divided<WH2505>; now shall they be found faulty<WH816>: he shall break down<WH6202> their altars<WH4196>, he shall plunder<WH7703> their images<WH4676>.
For now they shall say<WH559>, We have no king<WH4428>, because we feared<WH3372> not the Lord<WH3068>; what then should a king<WH4428> do to us<WH6213>?

They have spoken<WH1696> words<WH1697>, swearing<WH422> falsely<WH7723> in making<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285>: thus judgment<WH4941> springs up<WH6524> as hemlock<WH7219> in the furrows<WH8525> of the field<WH7704>.

The inhabitants<WH7934> of Samaria<WH8111> shall fear<WH1481> because of the calves<WH5697> of Beth<WH1007>–aven: for the people<WH5971> there shall mourn<WH56> over it<WH3649>, and the priests there that rejoiced<WH1523> on it<WH3519>, for the glory there<WH1540>, because it is departed from it.

It shall be also carried<WH2986> unto Assyria<WH804> for a present<WH4503> to king<WH4428> Jareb<WH3377>: Ephraim<WH669> shall receive<WH3947> shame<WH1317>, and Israel<WH3478> shall be ashamed<WH954> of his own counsel<WH6098>.
As for Samaria<WH8111>, her king<WH4428> is cut off<WH1820> as the foam<WH7110> upon<WH6440> the water<WH4325>.

The high places<WH1116> also of Aven<WH206>, the sin<WH2403> of Israel<WH3478>, shall be destroyed<WH8045>: the thorn<WH6975> and the thistle<WH1863> shall come up<WH5927> on their altars<WH4196>; and they shall say<WH559> to the mountains<WH2022>, Cover<WH3680> us<WH1389>; and to the hills, Fall on us<WH5307>.

O Israel<WH3478>, you have sinned<WH2398> from the days<WH3117> of Gibeah<WH1390>: there they stood<WH5975>: the battle<WH4421> in Gibeah<WH1390> against the sons<WH1121> of iniquity<WH5932> did not overtake them<WH5381>.

It is in my desire<WH185> that I should chastise<WH3256> them<WH5971>; and the people shall be gathered<WH622> against them<WH631>, when they shall bind themselves in their two<WH8147> furrows<WH5869>.

And Ephraim<WH669> is as a heifer<WH5697> that is taught<WH3925>, and loves<WH157> to tread out<WH1758> the corn<WH5674>; but I passed over upon her fair<WH2898> neck<WH6677>: I will make Ephraim<WH669> to ride<WH7392>; Judah<WH3063> shall plow<WH2790>, and Jacob<WH3290> shall break his clods<WH7702>.

Sow<WH2232> to yourselves in righteousness<WH6666>, reap<WH7114> in<WH6310> mercy<WH2617>; break up<WH5214> your fallow ground<WH5215>: for it is time<WH6256> to seek<WH1875> the Lord<WH3068>, until he come<WH935> and rain<WH3384> righteousness upon you<WH6664>.

You have plowed<WH2790> wickedness<WH7562>, you have reaped<WH7114> iniquity<WH5766>; you have eaten<WH398> the fruit<WH6529> of lies<WH3585>: because you did trust<WH982> in your way<WH1870>, in the multitude<WH7230> of your mighty men<WH1368>.

Therefore shall a tumult<WH7588> arise<WH6965> among your people<WH5971>, and all your fortresses<WH4013> shall be spoiled<WH7703>, as Shalman<WH8020> spoiled<WH7701> Beth<WH1009>–arbel in the day<WH3117> of battle<WH4421>: the mother<WH517> was dashed in pieces<WH7376> upon her sons<WH1121>.

So<WH3602> shall Beth<WH1008>–el do<WH6213> unto you because<WH6440> of your great<WH7451> wickedness<WH7451>: in a morning<WH7837> shall the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> utterly<WH1820> be cut off<WH1820>.
